definition[0]: at a time in the future or in the past, although you do not know exactly when
example[0]: Weâ€™ll take a vacation sometime in September.
example[1]: Our house was built sometime around 1900.
example[2]: Sir Richard Marsh, the sometime chairman of British Rail
definition[1]: used to say that someone does or has a particular job part of the time
example[3]: Grimm, a sometime delivery driver, lives with his elderly mother.
